title: Dental Hygiene Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of basic dental hygiene principles and practices

questions.questionText: What is the recommended frequency for brushing teeth?
questions.explanation: Dentists recommend brushing teeth at least twice a day - once in the morning and once before bed.

questions.questionText: How long should you brush your teeth for optimal cleaning?
questions.explanation: The American Dental Association recommends brushing for two minutes to ensure thorough cleaning of all tooth surfaces.

questions.questionText: Flossing is essential for maintaining good oral health.
questions.explanation: Flossing removes plaque and food particles from between teeth where a toothbrush cannot reach, making it essential for complete oral hygiene.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are benefits of regular dental checkups? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Regular dental checkups provide multiple benefits including early cavity detection, professional cleaning, gum disease prevention, and oral cancer screening.

questions.questionText: What is the main purpose of fluoride in toothpaste?
questions.explanation: Fluoride strengthens tooth enamel and helps prevent tooth decay by making teeth more resistant to acid attacks from bacteria.

answerOptions.optionText: To strengthen enamel and prevent cavities

questions.questionText: In one sentence, explain why flossing is important.
questions.explanation: Flossing removes plaque and food particles from between teeth, preventing gum disease.
